subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] patterns and categories of voice-like receptions , so far
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_3462_4c72_73bd
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed

You should try a randomly tuned TV for spook-a-vision. That's where the pix 
on the group home page came from. I think you already got this one. I did 
show it the movie clip for docu-drama guys. One of the neighbor kids says he 
can get stuff from TV, just like we do by tuing across the band, mostly it's 
audio messages.

Frank


>From: Ken Thomas <kennnthomas2000@...>
>Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
>To: evp-itc <EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] patterns and categories of voice-like receptions , so 
>far
>Date: Fri, 13 Apr 2007 12:38:39 -0700 (PDT)
>
>note to x:
>
>      i  think "necroradio" might put people off. i like the other one 
>tho-poryphoradio
>
>
>   &&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&
>   i notice that the chance emanations from this thing make my fluoresvcent 
>markers glo like an el panel.
>
>   what is so useful is that , in my absence from spook-o-vision,  ordinary 
>tech has advanced to where i can listen in real time--not near well enough 
>to understand what theyre saying though.
>   nevertheless , you can tell a lot by the shape of the transmissions -  
>mostly buoyant young adult types.  theres often chanting like monks and 
>to-and-fro like cheerleaders at football game, peculiar group, 
>"sing-talking".    lone mature male voices are usually in foreign accent . 
>theres a lot of clues just in the envelope.
>   im making tapes for evidence but they are pretty crappy so far.
>
>   not the faintest trace of perfidy
